title: Zed, and the inevitability of a lost lane.
body: I dont understand how a champion can snowball SO easily, with so little effort, pokes the entire lane with no resource cost, when you DO get enough mana to actually fight him, his ult, even if used incorrectly, instagibs you if you dont have the Hourglass. zzz Mid is just as stale as ever.

replies.body: Why not play a bruiser mid, or a mid that doesn't use mana?

Was just a blind game, I was trying out an old mid I used to like. I usually go Swain mid. But the amount of cheese bullshit that zed has against...anyone who isnt zed/kat is ridiculous. I couldnt even get near my minion wave as one WQ would shave off a quarter of my HP. this is AFTER I killed Zed for firstblood. He would ult me and I'd immediately counter with my ult on Cassiopea, only to have him poof away from under my tower and I explode. After that, every time he saw me it became a 'you're dead, no matter what' moment and there is nothing you can do about it until you buy hourglass.

You played a squishy short range burst caster that relies on skillshots vs Zed, I mean, yeah, of course it is going to be a little hard. Zed vs Cass is a skill match up honestly, you both have tools to beat each other.

Not hard. Impossible. Did exactly what most supports would do, stun him, under my tower, launch my full combo. Insta death with no repercussions. No minions around to block tower shots, stunned for half the duration of his death mark.  Why bother playing another mid when you could just press R.
You expect me to believe that this early game Zed lived after being stunned under tower...taking tower aggro...AND your DPS...then got away....really?
3 times. Even after I killed him twice.
I don't believe this or you.
He literally spammed his R, then his QE when he realized I stunned him, and escaped of course cause thats what Zed does. Dont know why it seems unbelievable. LCS BIG PLAYS.
After stunning him, why didn't you back up out of range, or back up until the mark popped?
He cast W as well, in the direction I was retreating. So Q and E got more range. I'm a slow, non mobility champ. Cant juke. Mobility creep unstoppable.

looking at your recent match history you have only played Cassiopeia once recently, and you did go 2/7/1 while a Zed in the same match when 10/4/1.   I should note you are silver 4 and the Zed is Gold 2, so its likely he could have done about the same if the matchup was the other way around, especially as you don't appear to play Cassiopeia much.

Cassio's stun usually comes after she has at least 100 stacks, so if you stunned a Zed under  your turret you could have just QEEEWEEE before he could move again and healed while destroying him.  The fact that you claim he survived that and killed you makes me wonder if you know how to use Cassiopeia's abilities.

I've faced worse situations on Cassiopeia and either survived, or taken someone with me.  (3v1 ganks when you know they are going to towerdive leaves you little opportunity to escape even when you hit your ult, especially when you want to save the turret if you can.)

Just got my placements in silver literally yesterday. I'm aware of a skill difference between the champions, I hit zed with my ult, then the combo you described. He had no kills at this point and I had one. Farm was even, he had one assist from the Wukong jungler killing my jungler. Yet his damage burst, survival and poke were much higher than mine. While I'm not an expert Cass, I've been successful in the past with her kit, it just feels overwhelming to fight a champion with unlimited 'free' poke thats only based on cd, easy as hell to hit, 2 blink abilites and all of his kit save for his R being aoe. While I use telegraphed attacks with Q and short range respectable sustained damage on an immobile mage with relatively high mana costs.

Point.

Cassiopeia is so immobile that it is very hard to avoid Zed's attacks.  I haven't had the misfortune of facing him as Cassiopeia.  I think the one time I ran into a Zed I was playing Diana, and I still had a hard time avoiding his seemingly constant spam of abilities.  (and I tend to try to stay behind minions at all times.)  I have taken Cassiopeia against Katarina and found that I could keep her away by using W to zone her from the minions and concentrating on last hitting while it was up.  It's inefficient and I don't get a great CS while doing it, but it kept Katarina from farming all that easily and kept her from trying to dive me.  It probably won't work quite as well on Zed because of his bloody shadow abilities, but that's all I can think of for the moment.

that and hope you have a jungler who can come gank early and often.

Thats honestly the biggest issue, when facing zed, the lane feels like its automatically 'out of my control' from the start, because you need to rely on your jungler to stop him in most cases, but as a jungler player, I know that mid ganks are sketchy at best, even without his 2 dash abilities to factor in.

I've faced Zed and I play Cass as my primary in mid.  Cass can take on Zed or Kat, but you have to be careful not to give him free opportunity to use his ult.

My best example would be a game where I took Cass against Katarina.  Its not exactly the same, but it was that short ranged burst caster relying on skillshots against a mobile cooldown only reliant assassin.  

We left the laning phase with neither of us having a clear advantage.  I kept her away and managed to hit enough poisons to force her to play careful and her mobility meant I couldn't pin her down to E her to death without putting myself into far too much danger of being ganked.

----
I'll be honest, I don't care for Zed as a champion.  He's exactly the type of flashy, overbearing creation that tends to reduce sportsmanship in a game because he's designed with a strong need to snowball which attracts the type of players who make natural bullies.  However, I have found that he's not impossible to defeat, just difficult.  I've even had a match recently where I ended up running into one in a teamfight and figured I was going to die, but threw all my abilities into the fight.  In the end I survived with a sliver of health left and was able to recall.  I even typed in all chat.  "how did I survive?" cause I had no clue why he didn't get me.  

Was a nice feeling to walk away though.  Sadly my team lost that match because we forgot the first rule when facing a Riven.

"No one is to feed the Riven."   :P

I'm glad we agree on the description of Zed, your last post was vaguely reminiscent of 'gg get gud nub' when you mentioned the ranked ratings of gold 2 versus silver 4, I get matched up with plats and diamonds in normals and do ok against them. While Zed isnt impossible to defeat ( i got first blood in that match off him) he certainly has two full fistfulls of tools to escape ganks, instagib, farm, splitpush, roam... the list goes on. I'm of the opinion that the reason Lissandra has come into her own popularity is she's effectively the most prominent 'anti zed' character around.

I wasn't trying to say "gg get gud".  

What I see a lot of in this forum is someone complaining.  "I can't beat X champ" and then demanding changes, but when you start asking questions you find that they either brought out a champ they don't know well, or were against someone who mains the champ they faced.  I've learned that experience on a champ matters.  And not just a little.  

Now some champs can be picked up easy, but that doesn't mean you are an expert.  On champs I have played dozens of times I still find new tricks that can be played.  And that is significant.  If you don't play a champ often, especially one like Cassiopeia who is extremely reliant on good skillshots and then expert timing on use of her twin fang you end up at a huge disadvantage against someone who has a lot more experience and practice on the champ you face.  That's one thing so many people forget.  Zed is one of the easier champs to pickup, but if your opponent was tower diving you, he probably had quite a few game on the champ and knew the limits of what he could do.  That's why I wondered if he could have done well if the roles were reversed.  He clearly knew how powerful you were and knew he could take the hits.  That suggests he probably knew Cassiopeia as well as you did if not more.

Funny thing is that is a huge part of why I come here.  I don't always face a champ, but reading the comments here gives me a good idea of what to expect when I do face a champ.  It gives me an opportunity to do some of the mental preparation before a match.  

Zed is a hard lane.  He's probably one of the worst to face mid-lane and it can be worse when you are elsewhere like jungle and your midlaner can't hold him off.   But my last experience like that was a teambuilder match where my group was helping break in a brand new player and he ended up taking his Garen to face Katarina midlane.  The funny thing was he held her off for over 10 minutes with only one death.  But he couldn't hold her in lane forever and eventually she started to feed.

Plenty aware of Cass' strengths and weaknesses, the only thing I have issue with is the amount of tools a single character has. Generalist, manaless assassin with escape and split push and typically wins a great deal of his lane match ups because of easy as shit mechanics gets frustrating. Especially when you see him game after game after game.

Honestly, that shouldn't happen to you as swain. Read the rest of the conversation here. Start cloth pots, and be prepared to farm under tower until a jungler comes. Yeah, it's a tough lane, but if you play it correctly, you can at least force him to roam instead of letting him feed on you.

'Its a tough lane' is what I seem to be hearing about anyone who faces Zed. I also wasnt playing swain, if I was, I would have exploited the early game gank I got on Zed and became a terror. I sadly was Cass, so even though I ulted him at the right time, not much of it seems to matter when he can instagib me post 6, because of the nature of Mana versus energy.

Fair enough. For the record, I agree that he's a bit too strong. I can't say that I've shared the inevitable losses that people keep talking about. I think he could use some tuning. Personally, I wish that it came in the form of limiting the damage on his shuriken. I think it's too strong moving through targets. In this case, would that have helped? Less wave clear, less ability to poke you through minions?

It would have imo. He's not 'vulnerable' in the same way Talon is limited by his mana, or fizz is limited by his only aoe being his escape tool. I think if they upped the energy cost of Q with a higher energy reward for landing W Q on the same target, with a mild decrease to base damage but increase the 'double' damage, he'd be a little more bearable. He's GREAT in lane phase when most mages are weak as hell, then at 6 it just gets worse.

Yeah, I hear you. I just think it's too easy to land Q, which is why I was suggesting that it not travel through targets. It just gives him too much power to be able to wave clear and poke at the same time. Then later, it becomes AoE. Not okay.
Honestly if it was aoe ONLY when he used his shadow it'd be less of a pain in the ass to lane against him, he can still 'aoe' just on a gated timeframe.
seems legit
Such a well thought out response I cant help but wholeheartedly agree.

Nothing is impossible. And you played Swain and didnt get Hourglass rushed against a Zed?

Also, Cass counters Zed incredibly hard. Stun him when he ults, back off or all in, you are fine. If he gets QSS, get a Zhonyas.
Who said I played Swain? I played Cass and did stun him after his ult under a tower. Didnt matter.

If you're a mana using mage/fighter/anything you aren't forced to go first item Zhonya's.

PSA: FROZEN HEART counters Zed and gives you a TON of stuff.

100 armor to cut his potential damage in half? Check
400 mana for more skills? Check
20% CDR? Check
AS slow aura, further lowering his all-in damage? CHECK

Especially if you have wave clear (a la Xerath, Ziggs, Lux, Velkoz, Diana) this makes it dangerous for Zed to roam. You can just shove the lane and follow after for a nice counter-gank while also chunking turret.

Tbh I never thought about FH as it gives no damage. But next time I'm forced against him as a mage I'll try this, couldnt hurt right? Its like fighting riven up top, deny her kills and she cant steamroll.
Do you always take ignite mid lane?
Depends on the champ. If its Velkoz I go Heal.

Play Kayle and Take Exhaust Flash or Play Lissandra with exhaust Flash.. Just Time you ult with his lol.. 

I play Kayle so i can let you know how i play against Zed...  

Few points to be noted are: His Shadow and his W range (dnt get hit by his shadow's W while trying to chase).. and Q cooldown..

At Lvl 1 you have E push and get Lvl 2 first and dodge those Shuriken he throws...

Punish him with Q-E or zone him off minions when he uses his Q to farm... but back off and w8 for his Q...also dnt overchase..

Remember his ult pops after 4 sec..  so when he ults use exhaust him first and trade.. then Ult to block the Death mark damage.. you should win almost all the trades like this

Final word: Ward and watch out for Ganks...

Also you can also get Zhonyas later if you want to save your ult for using it on someone else

Yeah I've played Kayle before, its quite the shame they gutted her so hard, she was the first 'assassin killer' She used to be my go to mid when facing assassins, might pick her up again. I had her last night in an aram I didnt really care about and the...lack of burst compared to what she used to have left a sour taste in my mouth.
try cloth start with 3 hp pots and 2 mana pots.  rush seekers and if you can afford it get a dorans on your first back as well.  pretty much impossible for zed to kill you if you do that.
not a bad plan. I'll be sure to try that next time I play against him. Thanks.
same thing can be said for every meta top + mid lol.
Overloaded kits dont go anywhere or fall out of favor because they have everything in spades, but Top is probably the least of offenders right now.

1. Zed's Q deals less damage if you are hiding behind minions - Do it so you won't get poked so hard.

2. Zed's W has 18-17-16-15-14 seconds CD so I don't see it as a SPAMMABLE tool for poke, not to mention that 18 seconds is ENOUGH for you to make a play and kill him with your jungler when he uses his W to extend his range.

3. When Zed ult's you, don't fucking panic, He will appear BEHIND you so keep that in mind, I saw people PANIC FLASHING during my ult cast so they carry me with their flash...Wait for Zed to finish his ult cast so you can potentially escape with your flash. ( Ye I saw that even in platinum, they flash even before I finish my R animation)

4. As a Zed player who plays him since he is released through buffs and nerfs I can tell you 1 thing, Laning vs Cassiopeia is EASY AS F*CK, but laning against GOOD CASSIOPEIA forces me to HEXDRINKER which is her advantage in lane.

5. As a Zed main, I have played Twisted Fate versus enemy ZED in platinum 3 and I annihilated him. Why? Becouse I know every single inch of Zed's kit. :)

Conclusion? People are afraid of a flashy champions, Zed's ultimate puts him on top of you, I know that's scary but there is enough time to react. Do not panic, that's all, try to hide behind minions, a good Zed player won't spam his W like a braindead, play something safe like Swain, Orianna, Good Viktor can easily annihilate Zed, Katarina vs Zed is a skill matchup, same goes for Ahri, Xerath and Malzahar, dont just pick something with high skill cap like Cassiopeia or something that's bad against Zed...for example, Yasuo, Lux, Ziggs, Kassadin, etc.
I saw people locking Lux when they see Zed in opposite side...lol, just lol.


PS: Do not get me wrong, I am not saying that Zed is not strong. He is strong indeed but he isn't an instawin champion, you can play around his kit and contribute from every single miss use of his kit, just learn how to do that and you will be fine. Personally, I would rather lane SOLO against 2 Zed's than against 1 Talon. Again, I am not saying Talon is stronger than Zed, but his E is one of the scariest things to me when I play something like Syndra or Zerath..INSTANT BLINK FTW!

I used to play zed, I'm well aware of what his abilities do. when I killed Zed early, it was with my jungler's help in a 1 for 1 (wukong helped zed get an assist) after that Zed got 6 at the same time I did and proceeded to ult me. Because I have to build mana items to actually lane against him, Zed had a brutalizer, giving him the sustained CDR to keep his W at a relatively low cd, it also gives him a TON more damage than a mana item as it gives none. So I'm already at a disadvantage despite gold advantage in my favor. Because I actually have a finite resource to mana beyond cds. When he ulted me, I used my entire combo on him, R, QEEE,WEEE and he was still able to get away. Because once the combo he lands hits, he need not worry about actually fighting, he can just escape right off the bat. My point? His kit does far too much for so little drawback, mana is a crutch.  Playing something safe has worked in the past, but I cant always pick the optimal champion in a blind pick. Zed however, can counter pick a large handful of the mid roster save for a few select champions. Meaning that the lane will likely be in his favor from the start.

Perhaps im not versed enough to speak on this topic, but for some reason or another I like {{champion:114}}  into {{champion:238}}  whenever I have the opportunity to play mid. I don't feel forced to build a QSS, perhaps thats because my ulti displaces me and makes me invulnerable a bit which is something not many if any AP mid laners can boast. However even pre-6 when I can quite easily be poked out (shurikens hutr gais D:) im not that bad off, I can trade with him if I just keep tabs on his cooldowns. I think thats honestly your best bet if you fight a Zed as any champion, practice csing under pressure and attack as soon as he blows a skill that puts you in a favorable position with him being unable to adequately respond. Thier hubris may be thier own downfall. also Stamina is a resource, Zed isn't resources-less, his resource is just superior to Mana.

He does tend to struggle against outright sustained duelists and tanks that can poke him back, thats why Lissandra does so well against his bullshit R. That said, if he's smart about ban phase he wont let you get a Lissandra on the map. The issue with Zed is that his weakness is 'you can just cc him' but it only matters if you do it within the 3 second window he gives you to counter him, and even THEN, as mentioned in this thread, it can sometimes not be enough. Other champs you can cc whenever you want, but Zed is like a single target Kat. 'You must interrupt me at this EXACT moment when I use my ult or I instagib you!' It just feels so one sided, even with characters designed to 'counter' his 'low range'.

I used to hate Zed and still do to a degree because I could never do well against him. It felt like you've put it and that there was nowhere safe to go without being poked constantly then an ult and POP I'm dead. I'm not a great player, I have my moments but what I do know is that I started to fully understand him after playing him. His ult itself does very little damage and relies on damage done before the mark triggers. Since I found that out one of the first things I'll do if I don't have Zhonya's is get away from him when he appears after using ult. Champions with dashes can do it more easily but for others you may have to flash away. If you're playing an immobile champion mid you may want to consider always taking exhaust. You have less kill pressure in lane but the times you face Zed or Yasuo will make it worthwhile.

Other ways to deal with him are pretty obvious. Cleanse summoner, QSS, Zhonya's or if you can stun him as he lands then the damage will be minimal. The really good Zed players will wait until you're already low on health, perhaps
Its just a frustrating lane unless you're Lissandra. You need to buy mana to actually successfully poke him, but Zhonyas to actually survive him, the ultimate catch 22.
